Have you ever seen those shots in movies where the hero is standing upright at the edge of a sheer mountain face, hair blowing in the wind? It probably wouldn't seem so heroic if you saw him ten minutes earlier, when a crew of stylists was carefully combing his hair so it would fall perfectly.
Both effective ways to commit suicide, hang your self from the ceiling with your belt or jump off a mountain.
Add water then the flowers. With both the vase will be full.

You decide one day to paint a kanji on your ceiling. Unfortunately, you don’t have a brush, so, being innovative, you use a sprout. Knowing it could be messy, you search for a drop-cloth, but can’t find one. Instead, you put a shovel down on the floor to catch any drips resulting from the BRUSH-STROKEs.
Stop shoveling rice into your mouth, you'll hurt a tooth! Use chopsticks instead.
It looks like the mouth of Bender the robot which becomes bent when he starts talking.
A space cadet named Cao eager to make one bend around the sun.
Close encounters of the third kind - space cadets meet with aliens on the road.
Bender the cadet is rowing, during some army exercise, and he's very afraid of water (Bender is a robot).
Also as part of some army survival exercise, the cadets are sent into the woods to build a vat or trough for collecting water.

Since the meaning of "big dipper" is rather specific and the sense of measurement seems to be a more common usage, I concentrate on the primative meaning of measuring cup. This is a pictograph, with the first two strokes representing the measuring ticks on the side of the cup.
When buying rice, the fee is calculated by the cup. Naturally we don't just use any cup; it has to be a measuring cup made from the right material.
University departments study academic disciplines like wheat (agriculture) and the big dipper (physics/astronomy), and exact measuring cups (engineering).
A treasure map: two dots represent big trees and the cross (marking the treasure) is placed relative to them.
To tenderize meat in an emergency wilderness situation, just utilize your big walking stick!
To live a comfortable life, single men need only a cave for living, a rake for cleaning and a screwdriver for fixing and doing a mediocre job for income.
Mr. T wants to climb up and pick the flowers at the top of the cliff. He equips and prepares himself with screwdrivers to use as climbing spikes to reach the top of the cliff.
Once upon a time, in times past, the children were forced to eat their salad every day.
Once upon a time, people of the world got confused and were often mistaken because there were so many kinds of Metal coins. today we only have the euro.
Once upon a time I let Mr. T borrow my salad bowl, but he won't give it back. "This be mine now, foo!".
My state of mind when I think of the opportunities I missed from once upon a time is to rue and think "what a pity."
Once upon a time our ancestors set aside the use of fingers to arrange food and began to use cutlery.
The taskmaster is dissatisfied with the meal she's served, and scatters the salad & meat across the floor for the servants to clean up.
A generation is 30, one stroke less is twenty.
Twenty commoners have to huddle in caverns around a campfire, while higher class people get heating and central air conditioning in a hotel.
The commoners are intercepted on the road and screened for drugs.
The cave commoners make floor mats with towels to use as seats.

The cavern commoners are so poor that they can't afford thermometers. So, the menfolk expose their crotches inside the cavern, and approximate the temperature in degrees from how shrivelled everything looks downstairs...
This particular form of transit is a ferry (one of the actual meanings of this character). Naturally it can only cross the water if it's not frozen, so the temperature must be above 0 degrees.
A big St. Bernard dog likes to dash towards the hay stack and bustle his way through it.

History of Pompei: An unexpected eruption and from the mouth of the volcano comes lava spurting that threatens the farmers collecting haystacks in the fields and the fisherman catching shells on the coast.
After the eruption all is a tomb. The soil has covered the remains of the farmers gathering haystacks and of the fisherman collecting shells.
Aroused here refers to anger over some unjust or wrong act. An angry state of mind is aroused when finding all your clams buried under your haystack stolen, gone!
Ah, there's no better way to bake a pizza than an oven fueled by a burning strawman.
The sun rising beside a strawman in a corn field is a classic cartoon depiction of daybreak.
Imagine karate chopping the number three in half with a walking stick and pausing the picture just as the first "board" breaks into two clean and even pieces.
Mr. T's other half is his consort, or partner in life.
A paddy ridge divides the rice field in half and the rice field ends at a littoral (i.e on the shore of a body of water).
A saber can cut something in half with good judgment, i.e by one who judges well.

Entering the movie, the dude asks for your ticket voucher so he can tear it in half. He looks at you funny when you hand him a ticket already torn in half. He quietly tears the stub into quarters after you show him your dagger with a smile.
At the end of the quarter you have to do an exam paper on snakes and the ancient snake scroll.
The scroll is kept pent in because of its power, but when it's used it makes a sphere, or circle of influence, inside of which it can get you.
After your victory cut your enemy's flesh into quarters to show your power.
According to legend, the great Ogaki wisteria tree grew and flowered from magical rice grains that were planted under the quarter moon. (rattan tree in chinese)
Sending a facsimile to the moon can be problematic only a quarter of the words actually get there.
A man kneeling and presenting a ring with a nice slice of diamond to his future wife - a one-sided proposition.

Before the advent of printers in Japan, typewriters couldn't be built as they were in the west due to how many kanji there are. Lots of small printing blocks, or printing plates had to be used instead. One side of the printing block would have a mirrored (anti-) image of the kanji. This is true.
Of all the kanji, this is the only one 之orro (zorro) can write.
Just one drop of alcohol and 之orro starts walking in zig-zags and becomes weary of everyone – no wonder Zorro lives in destitution.
Zorro, with a sesame flower between his teeth for the ladies, defends his turf against evildoers. "This is my turf! And this...is for the lady.".
[Smithsonian] Scene: Mr. T hanging from the ceiling being tortured. He is asked if he is going to talk. Spitting (a drop of saliva) in the torturer's face, he says "Negative".
To distinguish between 否 negate, and 不 negative (#1217): Note that negate contains 口, which is a kind of gate.
The maple tree is very negative about it, but the farmer still collects cupfuls of maple syrup from it.
Zeus ran out of lightning bolts and has to drop darts from the heavens.
Angels have now been given a powerful tool to rectify human behavior instantly, without delay - they have been allowed to drop darts on those who misbehave... spare the dart and spoil the man...
With a banner declaring "Keep Out!" and blow darts to back it up, the Amazon tribe is not that friendly.
I should know. After all, I did graduate from Dartmouth!
Wisdom is knowing everything OVER the sun (fools assume everything UNDER).
マオ Mao Zedong always carried a halberd.
To get something out of a tree just give it a tender gentle tap with a halberd.
It is with the halberd he holds that the taskmaster exerts his power over those actually performing the task.
This fog is the perfect weather for us to perform our task undetected.
The kings have a world class squad of saber fighters to guard them.
When warriors come back home from battle they put down their sabers and the wives use brooms to sweep their homes clean for a homecoming party.
My personification for this primative is Legolas from the Lord of the Rings: a master at the bow. I suppose robin hood etc would work too.
To draw back a bowstring put a walking stick in the bow, pull it back, and release to fire.
Pictograph of a soldier's weapons, his sword and bow placed over his body before burial, while people offer their condolences.
If you pull the bow back with your elbow, you can shoot a vast distance. It's a noble man's way to shoot as you don't have to dirty your fingers.
An insect who can fly vast distances is strong.

Two weak archers agree on a duel to the death. They constantly shoot at each other but never manage to hit their target. But what they lack in skill they make up in determination, and they keep shooting for hours, and days, and months, until it's wintertime and their bows are coated in ice.
This liquid looks like ordinary water, but it will instantly seethe when it comes in contact with counterfeit dollar bills. You dont even need to turn on the heat and bring to a boil.
An expense is an expense, whether you put it in dollars or in local money.

The No. 1 currency in the world is the dollar. But, the Asian nations are fast catching up and may in reality have already surpassed it. So, let the bamboo represent the No. 2 currencies (the yen, etc.). The reverse order (bamboo on top and the dollar on the bottom) is really a look at the future.
Younger brothers are always more prone to mischief. Mine, you can almost see the little horns on him and the dollar signs on his eyes when he comes up with a money-making scheme.
When crafting a bear trap, one must be adroit / skillful.
My nickname, or appellation, is "No Lips". Yep, I shouldn't have put my mouth on that bear trap...

This snare isn't terribly effective, because it's swinging from a decaying tree. Imagine the tree as being so decayed that when an animal gets caught in the snare, its struggles cause the tree to collapse into a putrid mess.
The hunter's boast and brag: I say, it was a "big one", but the snare broke and it got away.
A hunter washes, with water, his two snares, because they are dirty and filthy.

David went to battle with a slingshot and it only took him one shot to slay Goliath. Partly because of this, the prophet Nathan was later instructed to bestow upon David, or offer him, the throne of all Israel.
A crown was bestowed to the best copy writer.

Somebody was just looking for you. He had a longnose that reaches down below his mouth, and a long jaw that sticks out past his nose, and a scar across his face. (greenapple,16-3-2006) The way to remember that this is somebody rather than someone (#1256) is that the story is full of body descriptions.
You SHOOT SOMEBODY with a GLUE-gun.
It's not enough for children to apologize for their bad words sometimes. Tough moms wash a little somebody's mouth out with glue and tell them to say thank you afterwards.

An old man, wondering what it's like in a grave, sits in a freshly dug plot. When a gravekeeper mistakes him for dead and begins burying him with soil, the old man saves himself by flailing his walking stick in the air.
Before shooting an old man with a slingshot, one should carefully consider the possible consequences and maybe even take an exam on old men first.
This child has taken filial piety to the next level. He is actually carrying the old man on his shoulders.
In early Japan, filial piety was the cornerstone of education, and harsh taskmasters were employed to teach it.
Consider flogging their fingers as a form of torture if students take an exam and dont do well.
Compound for ninja: 忍者 A ninja is not just a 身 (somebody), it's 者 (someone) like an old man with a walking stick who has been alive for a certain number of suns and can 忍 (endure) a lot!
Here I am boiling my puppet over the flames to warm her up a bit...
Here I am, putt-ing a wreath of flowers on my puppet's head and pretending she is someone of great renowned.
Before add your john Hancock, or give your signature, to accept the puppet you should eye it over for any damages, then give your signature.
Ahh, a fine sultry day with my love doll in the summer heat under the hot sun. I think she's getting a tan!
Because i get tired of saying the same old thing, I have lately been trying to use various terms of endearment to my puppet. I think she appreciates it too.
A pack of wild dogs thought the puppet was a wild boar or pig and had it for dinner.
The puppet washes up on the strand (shore) after happily letting the water take her around for a while.
When we gamble at the shell game, I always win against my puppet.
A gorge looks like someone cut into a mountain with a pair of scissors.
In a cramped narrow space, a man holds off a pack of wild dogs with scissors.
In a packed Tokyo train your fingers get coerced and sandwiched between the doors which are like a pair of dull scissors.
Maestro, coattails flapping wildly, is being chased down the road by his fans.

The maestro is a teacher during the week but in the weekend in a large auditorium with high ceilings he is conducting his orchestra of expert musicians at a fever-pitch, sweat pouring out of him. When the piece is over he reaches for his towel to wipe his brow.
The commander is a military maestro who never throws in the towel.
No one likes classical music anymore. Our Maestro is here at home without his baton sighing sadly before he heads off for another day as his new job as a bureaucrat.
An excellent use of wood is to make coffins for bureaucrats.
Japanese bureaucrats send all their messages through an inter-office bamboo pipe system.
Luke, I am your father. Darth Vader (really surprised nobody put this one up before: two light sabers).

Even though your FATHER is an old man, he can't give up his party lifestyle. Once a week he still dons his cool TOP HAT (well, it was cool 40 years ago) and goes out on the town to MINGLE with the ladies. This is a pretty common thing in Japan, where old motherfuckers still think they can pick up 19 year old girls.
Mingling with the powerful can bring you success, bypassing the need for any merit.
Mingling with car lovers is relatively, or in contrast to other people, a little boring because they only talk about cars.
After taking the exam, the schools that accepted them were posted on a tree. The students mingled around trying to find their names. (コオ).
Captain Ahab lost his leg to the great white whale's mouth and had to mend it with a peg leg.
You have the urge to stimulate a person by giving him a kick.
You can step a long-distance if you have a leg that's gigantic!
When pirates try to hide, it's always easy to find them. Their wooden legs leave distinctive prints, showing where each is hiding and the exact path he took.
After the rain the path was covered with dew.
A turtle with a wooden leg needs to hop to get around.
You use your legs to leap off the roof thinking it would be fun to land on that futon down below.
The pirate with the wooden leg chased after the parade float and was run over by the next one, leaving tread marks all over him and his leg.
You have to watch what you step on when moving your leg on a watery day or else you can fall and get trampled.
Your body meat is attached to the bone joints of your skeleton.
Don't give water to a skeleton. When he drinks it, it'll sluice right through his bones, forcing you to put one of those "Caution - Slippery Floor" signs up on the resultant puddle.
A skeleton is on the road trying to get a lift with his marrow which is the only thing he still possesses.
If the gods are feeling particularly mischievous, they'll send down a jawbone to the altar and people see this as a sign of calamity and misfortune to come.
Grampa's flushing the toilet, when his denture (Jawbone) pops out and gets sucked down the whirlpool water!
Jaws XII~! Jaws crosses the highway! Man, they're really overdoing it now.
If you're scared of Heights, you don't want to stay at The Pinnacle; you are anti- The Pinnacle.
At the pinnacle you see famous people or gods like Apollo and you can see far off places like Africa.
On occasion, rituals are held at the very tip of The Pinnacle.
The officer at the barrier to The Pinnacle has a giant badge sewn to his chest which allows him to hinder all visitors if he wants.
You follow a road to pinnacle because it's the only place that will allow you to do as you wish and possess what you want.
In case of emergency, The Pinnacle has auxiliary guard dogs to accompany people, but they keep them muzzled until they're needed.
A kid named Yang is perched on a pinnacle with his piggy bank. He uses the coins to catch the sunshine, and redirect it into people's eyes, far below.
Every morning at The Pinnacle, the residents line up on the east side for morning stretches to exhibit their flexibility.
A giant compass is The Pinnacle's self-defense system. It points in the direction of any invaders so the city is prepared well ahead to ward off the intruders.
A sign was affixed on the pinnacle of the Acropolis so that tourists would adhere to the rules.
The Inst.itution of The Pinnacle is perfect in every way. It is the new House of God, his chosen city.
Paparazzi make camp outside of The Pinnacle in their cars, waiting in battle formation for the celebs to come out.
Every regiment of The Pinnacle's army is lead by a Miss Piggy with a viking helmet on. She knows how to bring team together.
components: miss piggy with a viking helmet

parts.meaning: miss piggy with a viking helmet

story: One of the members of our air force regiment has been shot down; he managed to safely eject, but his plane plunged and crashed into the ground.
Sunglasses-missing-one-lens" is obviously the monocle. The proper, high-class way to descend The Pinnacle is wearing a monocle with walking legs splayed to a full gentlemanly stride.
All buildings of The Pinnacle are multi-story and have lots of stairs.
Your highness is the pinnacle of finesse compared to all of us commoners who are but like dirt on the ground.
America thinks it is the pinnacle of the world, looking down on all neighboring rice countries through its mirrored, aviator sunglasses.
The Pinnacle city's councilmen have isolated and separated all professional photographers to make sure they don't photograph their "dirty secrets".
The wheat farmer's heart is calm because his pinnacle farm is concealed and hidden from dangerous people or animals.
Any attempt to possess the pinnacle will degenerate into a ground war.
The Pinnacle is actually bound up by supports from olden times. Eventually, they give out, and the whole thing starts to collapse.
A black hole is a "House of Infinity". Infinity is of course represented by a sideways eight, but here we have a Japanese eight instead.
The craft of creating a black hole is in creating an empty space which can attract things.
Your fingers are empty because you can't control your money and withdraw too often.
When you stab something abruptly you leave a big hole.
Most research scientists have nine holes.....two nostrils, two ears, a mouth, and four eyes...... :-).
Sticking a plug up your hole will lead to stronger climaxes.
Stealth more commonly means steal or pilfer, like how a thief cuts a hole to steal the jewels.
A depression is a hole in the ground. Water naturally collects there which provides moisture for vines to grow.
You have trouble squeezeing your hand through the hole so you use a saw to enlarge it.

Be sure to put a hole in that ceramic sheep before you put it over the fire. Otherwise, it'll just explode in the kiln. (If you've never done ceramics before, it's important that the object have a hole in it, or this really will happen.).
Hard up and poor you have nothing but your body, living in a hole, and just a bow to hunt for your food.
A spying pervert on the train gropes not just holes with his fingers, but trees too! lol
If the groper's "tree" goes up the girl's miniskirt too deep, he'll let fluid go.
Excalibur is the sword planted in a rock. Lesser known Axe-calibur is the axe planted in the ground on top of a hill.
A point is an extra little hill at the top of a mountain. We'll call it 'Fireman's Axe Point'. It can take one yue (Mandarin for 'month') to get there.
Listen up soldiers, our troops are going to take that hill! You are no longer men with human legs. You are voracious animals, with animal legs! Got it? Animal legs! Now take that hill!
The coast guard are water soldiers lined up on the seacoast defending our shores.
Looks like a messy piece of thread.
Spiderman weaves his way through the skyline while listening to his theme song on his ipod. It is played, of course, by kazoos.
After a day being virtuous and keeping the city safe, Spiderman's outfit is in need of some repair. Luckily, as he can shoot out threads darning (mending a hole) is very easy for him to do.
After spending the night at an inn, spiderman discovered to his dismay that his costume had shrunk (shrink) in the wash, and no longer fit!
Venom is a luxuriant (abundant or lush in growth, as vegetation) suit for the right host, but can't beat Spider-Man, even after numerous tries.
When Spiderman does his amazing vertical wall climbing, a throng of photographers accompanies him to get a good shot of the action.
Spiderman does a hot spring tour of Japan using the train lines. You can see the Spidey costume hanging on the washing line as he enjoys the onsen.

Spiderman managed to get behind the sovereign and tightened a web around the sovereign's throat. As long as the sovereign says what spidey whispers, he will be fine. Sovereign yelping : ' we will draw are troops back! and we will spend more money on healthcare, schools and less on wars!' Spidey whispering: ' If you continue at this pace, you might be doing good things AND the people will like you.'.
Hey, Spidey! Eat that turkey if you want, but make sure you eat some fibers: you want spidey threads, don't ya?
Lots of girls in Japan wear silk gauze patches over one eye made of course by white fibers.
Spidey stays on the east side of the city to practice. The West Side is too dangerous.
Spiderman has a secret fetish - since the inception of his puppet he likes nothing better than to dress it in a thong. Wierd, eh!
Even though Peter Parker has become Spiderman, he continues to sell pictures that he takes as a photographer.
There's never a picture of Spiderman meeting Peter Parker, not even a painting... I wonder why?
Spidey is alloted the biggest crime fighter jurisdiction in NYC because his overall arrest record is the best in the space time continuum.
Spiderman hates going to parties and having to mingle. He wants to strangle someone after just a little small talk and ends up wanting to wring everyone's neck by the end of the night.
Spiderman wanted to be a salaryman, but the suit just didn't fit him so he had to give it to someone else.
When each thread becomes entwined it can become a web.
Good luck getting out of it if Spiderman ties you up.
This winter is so cold that spiderman's web gets brittle! Could this be the end of spiderman?
Spiderman reaches out for his friend's answer sheet because this test is hard for his class rank.
Worst fan fiction ever....spiderman joins the chronicles of narnia to travel go another epoch and battle a big snake!!
Spiderman crafted a crimson red costume to fight crime in.
After a criminal gets let in by a family Spiderman stops him and the family gets a settlement.
Spiderman can do web spinning in any direction.
Spiderman got distracted when a disorderly man yelled, "Spiderman, wait a minute." He turned around and flew into a building. ("part" also means "minute").
Spiderman seduces all the girls he's introduced to and gets acquainted with.
A sutra holds things together like Spiderman's spool holding scriptures together.
To monkeys Spiderman's physical abilities make him a member of the gentry and they call him 'sire'.
Anytime Spiderman breaks a promise and doesn't show up to an appointment, Aunt Mae hits him with her ladle.
Dainty women work with fine thread rather than in a field.
Spiderman has a big brain because he accumulated it from many tired nights of studying.
Spiderman gets ten crowns for helping to pull cords and large ropes at construction sites to get large objects to high places.
Spiderman could not achieve general acceptance by the media even after winning the public's heart.
Spiderman continuously wears his polyethylene suit so he likes the white cotton towels he wears while lounging around the apartment.
Spiderman loves to put his mouth on Mary Jane's silky body, and Mary Jane likes the tough silk Spiderman wears.
After stopping a bank heist, Spiderman is seen winding his webbing around the stolen goods to trap them in a tree until the police arrive to take them back.
Spiderman is hooked on rice. It's all he inherited from his Uncle Ben so the only way to carry on his legacy.
Spiderman's nemesis the Green Goblin is in a slump; He's replaced his glider with a broom and is throwing grains of rice instead of bombs.
The pig helps to keep the house clean with the broom which is the reason Spiderman has an affinity for him.

Spiderman traps The Rhino under the hood of his famous netting, where even Rhino's horns can not break free, in fact if the netting did not dissappear after a few hours then Rhino might even perish in there.
Whenever Venom is tense and tight, he loses control of his sex drive and becomes a slave to his crotch.
Venom starts to choke on a spoon. He's about to get it out, when you manage to stop the spoon from getting out, so he turns purple, as he chokes, and dies.
Spidey's webs bind fast to truss Dr. Octopus using the Doc's own metal limbs!

The tortoise has escaped! We tied it up with a straw rope, but all that's left of the rope are some torn threads, and the unbound tortoise is nowhere to be found. (Note that the right half here is not "eels". This is (in my opinion) a mistake in the RTK book, as we already decided in waterfall (#537) to refer to the simplified form of dragon as "eels". It is much better to call the right half of this character an "unbound tortoise".).
In its infancy, a young butterfly is protected by a cocoon, as it doesn't yet have any power of its own.
Column of walking legs (caterpillar) getting into a cocoon, about to leave its past self behind.
The villagers haven't the faintest idea that giant cocoons secluded in the mountain are soon to hatch.
At the Mexican fiesta, there is a cocoon eating competition. How many cocoons can one person eat? No one has managed more than two before giving up...
An abacus is a mechanism or machine made of wood used to calculate how many 'anythings'.
What could be more mysterious than a cocoon in a top hat trying to sneak in...? (Pimitive: GANDALF).
This mysterious rice field grows not only rice, but livestock too! Picture little pigs and chickens growing right out of the ground, among the rice plants. How bizarre!

One sneaky farmer wanted to amass a large collection of livestock. We all know that cows like to eat flowers, so he planted lines of flowers leading to his own fields. The livestock followed the lines, eating the flowers one by one, and amassed in his field.
A magic bow that only Gandalf can yield: there is no bowstring on it, and he uses his magic to fire arrows.
A mysterious turkey with human fingers wants to hug me... I will never go to Tokyo Disneyland again!
Water is doubly mysterious. It's in all our nourishment...and yet, it's really not nourishing at all.
Mercy comes from the doubly mysterious kindhearted heart of God.
A magnet is a rock with two sides; one that mysteriously pushes and one that pulls; doubly mysterious. (see astridtops' story).
DNA, a drop of looong spiraled thread that is the key to your lineage.
Mr. T gets a DNA test, and discovers that he can relate to the person in charge because he was meant to be the person in charge after all.
Your grandchild is the child of your DNA.
The prefecture has suspended all DNA research for heart disease because of corruption. All involved will be suspended by their wrists.
Gone is the time when we had to withdraw money for stamps - now we can use e-mail instead.
Shins are the part of the body above the foot that Japanese traditionally sit on instead of their asses.
You stop selling horses wholesale because the cost of stamps and unloading is too much.
People line up for a wholesale charity event at an honorable imperial supermarket. Everyone pays wholesale prices!
It's customary to cover the flesh with clothing, but some designs are so outrageous they're not bigger than a stamp that just covers your crotch.
When you're born, your fate is measured, fitted, and stamped onto your soul. Good luck defying it.

(re: dingomick) "These are your orders," declares the general while passing out documents at the meeting. As everyone started to leave, the general exclaims "Oh wait! I need to certify these orders!" and went around stamping each paper with his personal chop-seal.
The amount of people that can order the rain to rain is zero.
You know you are fast approaching a ripe old age and have done a good length of service to society when you get orders from the dentist to get new teeth.
To keep your water cool or cold, just order some ice.
The orders on this page from the court claim jurisdiction of this vehicle, the cop says.
Some restaurants have a small bell of gold to call someone to take customers' orders.
I imagined some kind of initiation rite in old China, where every young man has to show his courage. They then receive a chopseal which is a mark of their courage.
No need to communicate with other drivers if you have a pogostick to get through traffic.
The winner of the long jump competition was disqualified when they found he used a pogo stick tied to his leg to jump further.

(Katsuo) You come at the zoo entrance. 'Here sir, a spoon to feed the animals.' cool 'and a dart(gun) in case stuff go wrong' ....' please chop-seal (sign) here for in case of accidents the zoo is not responsible.' 'lion feeding time is. bla bla' You are having serious doubts about if you still want to go into this zoo.
Ask a mimic to give an impression of doubt, and he will simulate it by scratching his head with his finger.
I doubt that the jello would congeal sitting on the counter, so I placed it in the icebox.
This pattern made of bamboo is for a new model of car designed to leave as small an ecological fingerprint as possible.
Crimes can often be solved using the tools of dogs and fingerprints.
Seeing some fingerprints at the edge of a cliff, I wondered who that unlucky person was.
You're bound up by ropes to an unlucky person. It's dangerous, because whatever happens to him will happen to you too.
Your address should be displayed on your house and mailbox so people dont go winding around the neighborhood trying to get to your place.
Like in Memento, I tattoo my address on my forearm flesh so I don't forget it, but I dont put any on my wrist because it hurts.
Japanese "gardens" aren't anything more than a pot of flowers on top of the mailbox.
I couldn't drop my grudge against him so I put a severed pig's heart in his mailbox to show resentment.
The willow is the tree that droops likes a hare's ears.
The Easter Bunny dropped an egg on my desk and got yolk all over my receipts and stamps.
Got a receipt for that dagger, son? If not, we're going to detain you and send you to stay and work in the rice fields.

There's a buyback program where you can trade in your dagger for money. But it's quite ineffective, since only registered dagger-owners with the original receipts can participate, and not criminals with illegally-purchased daggers.
Before sticky backs, they had to staple stamps to letters now there are printers which can do that for you.
Looks like a big stereo system which is a very common form of entertainment and excitement around the world.
The sign of the bird on this whiskey bottle is of course the Famous Grouse blended Scotch.
Sake is like a watered down Japanese liquor.
In bartending school the students use a ladel to pour wine into a flask.
The secrets of whiskey fermentation are passed to the son who displays the most filial piety.
It's cruel and brutal to pour alcohol down a cow's mouth.
Imagine a different kind of tax refund - instead of money, the state repays you with whiskey.
To stay healthy, Dr. Phil told me to have some dairy products with each bottle of whiskey I drink...
Drinking alcohol that's turned to vinegar feels like a saw going down your throat.
God you're drunk! How many whiskeys did you have? nine? ten?
To distribute whiskey during prohibition you had to be as sneaky as a snake.

land (#1513) Deciding to use the diamond-shaped water caltrop flower as cover/protection, the rice-seedlings with their walking legs (now free from soil), can start their journey.

land (#1513) However, the pinnacle that the rice-seedlings finally reach with the use of their walking legs turns out not to be the Promised Land after all, but simply a mausoleum (containing many dead rice-seedlings exhausted from previous quests?). Oh no!

Japanese cypress (hinoki) is grown for its high-quality wood, which is used in the building of "temples, shrines, traditional noh theatres, baths" etc. So, this tree is vital to the construction of many of the major meeting places in Japanese society.
My wife wanted a special place to perch and roost, so I built her one - on top of that tree.
If you want to nestle, the west side of the tree is best – otherwise you get woken up by the sun in the morning, so perch on the west side.
I learned this one from the movie Evil Dead, but when it grows late, trees change shape and their stalks become spiny creatures! Lesson: don't go out at night.
When you see bellflowers next to a tree, ring them for good luck.
A temple grove has bodies buried under the soil next to trees around the temple, and tourists are prevented from entering the area.
All the grain that was spilled under the tree looked like a mosaic, but someone took a grain rake and disposed of it.
An oar looks a little like a wooden tail.

At cooking school, I learned that there's always a relation between the item you will pestle and the size of the wooden pestle itself. When I read in a cooking book that I had to mash up a horse with a wooden pestle, naturally a tried to obtain a tree to do the job.
Wood of a certain length can be used as a cane.
This is the kanji for the shii tree, on which shiitake (椎茸) mushrooms grow. It's easy to picture a turkey dropping by the shii tree to gobble down some of those sweet oaky (shiitake) mushrooms.
The most revered tree is one that can be used as a wine barrel.

A palisade is a "fence of stakes especially for defense," usually the stakes are very strong, set closely together, and pointed on top. Tome can be seen as a pictograph of several close-set wooden stakes, braced by one horizontal bar.

The village that made its living out of catching fish above all was prone to be raided by pirates. So they made a watch turret (small tower) out of trees and would look every day if the pirates were coming.
A sturdy oak was the tree I tried to build with my stack of pancakes and waffles, but it didn't turn out to be so sturdy.
A wooden ladle is of course a ladel made out of tree wood.
A kid falls out a tree and the father exclaims, "Damn, son! Watch where you're going when you go damson (plum) picking".
Before cotton (#1367) is made into thread for Spider-Man's white towels, it simply grows on a tree as raw cotton.
Escutcheons are noble shields that depict the coat of arms of a family. They are usually made out of wood.
A Japanese hackberry tree is a type of tree that only has full foliage in the summer. It loses its foliage in the winter.
A birch tree can have a great aura of splendor with it's shiny white coated trunk.
When Sir Lancelot wants a new lance or gun he goes down to the godown (they have a nice weapon selection for sale) and tries some out by thrusting them into a nearby tree.
The mulberry (#698) may be nice and let you dance around it, but if it were a wild mulberry tree it would try to protect itself by throwing rocks at you.
How do you make a bale? Simple. You take a tree, like the one on the left, and you pent it up like the one on the right. Just like that.
A loquat is a tropical fruit tree, that compared to other trees has an odd seasonal pattern: it's fruit is ripe in late winter or early spring.
A downspout is made by hollowing out a tree and placing it to carry water "traffic" from your rooftop down to the ground.
Santa needs to wear 3 fur coats when he rides his wooden sled.
To the enjoyment of humans, many trees are carriers of delicious fruits.

Two birds high up in a tree drying out after flying through a storm. "How will we get back on track? We lost our bearings!" number one cries. "Don't worry," the other one says, as he flips out his mobile. "I have it bookmarked."

I see a tree with an exclamation mark painted on it. "Why is that?" I think, "An exclamation mark indicates danger, but it's only a tree". Then a coconut drops on my head like a ton of wood. Ah, it's a coconut tree.
Sandalwood is the ideal wood for a podium: it's easy on your sandals!
We were seeking shelter for the rain under the plotosid tree, but someone had put a double snare there. As if that foul smelling tree wasn't enough trouble already.
The zelkova is a sort of elm tree that is very good for making bonsais, setting a standard for other trees, so to speak.
Due its tendency to encrypt all its messages, the cryptomeria has been a fairly prosperous tree whereas all the other trees have already fallen prey to espionage.
Cedar trees are so copious they only come in groves. Other trees also like them because they are well-mannered.

One of my favourite pastimes is that I like to jump out of a tree on my pogo stick and try to land in a bucket. When successful it makes a very satisfying "clang". (Note: new primitive pogo stick = chop seal + utilize, for explanation see my entry at traffic (#1408).).
The lazy way to draw an ellipse requires two wooden pegs and some string.
The star-anise is an evergreen tree kept in secrecy for it's aromatic oil.
I requested that the furry cat do something and he spit up a furball.
Twinkle, twinkle little star, oops my futon is on fire. (futon = feathers + turkey)
The fires outside the puptent of the sentinel are watchfires.
A gigantic fire was started by the Olympic torch.
I'm really bad at getting fires to burn, I needed kindling from a whole grove of trees before I managed to kindle the fire.
A mummy is running around the room on fire after his moxa (liquid extracted from dry leaves for medical use) treatment goes wrong.
After the incident where the insect made a pitiful voiced sound, you decide to free it. Immediately it is attracted to the candlelight and flies into the fire. Bugger!
Fanning the flames with the other fan.
Teacher: "How is soot formed?" Student: "Well, a so-and-so makes a fire with coal and at the end there is black soot!".
The East is the best at making metal refined because their fires are the best at firing.

After the evening rice, the guest set out to entertain the children of the house with a dazzlingly brilliant show. He pulled a wand seemingly from out of his crotch and suddenly it appeared to be on fire! Ohs and ahs ensued.
The cook's fire was so strong that he needed to use a ladle to block the refulgent (bright) shine and being scorched by the fire.
With an iron that has been in the fire, each beast is subjected to branding.
When The Pinnacle collapses, there'll be plenty of flames for sure.
The fire was contained in the valley (they put a roof over it to keep it from spreading) but it grew hot enough in there to fuse metal... when it was over, the valley looked like a giant mirror!
In many asian restaurants, meat is roasted it sauted right in front of you over flames.
If a fire goes smoothly you will have stew in no time.

In Kazad-dum, Gandalf found a mysterious crown. It really helped his magic, but when they came back to Rivendell, he had become irresistable to the cows (small side-effect). He tried to tug the crown off, but did not succeed and so he continued to lead along...

The cow in this frame 牝 is filling a spoon with milk from its udders, so it must be a female animal. (The cow in the next frame 牡 is rolling around in the soil and is, not surprisingly, a male animal.).
Male animals are dirty pigs, or to be nicer dudes, in English, but in Japanese they are dirty cows ボ ボウ おす お- おん-.
The king entrusts his most precious stone to his pet condor. It quickly flies off to the mountains if anyone else tries to take it.

The mechanism in my old grandfather clock suddenly broke with an almighty chimea and one of the gem jewels was thrown out through the window into a nearby grove of trees. I'm now searching for the jewel in the grove while the clock continues to chime incessantly.
“The king has been detained by some marines!” “How do you know they were marines?” “Because they were wearing marine blue.”.

Two kings, kilt: After an hour in the onsen, the two scottish kings, both heavily speckled like the scottish are wont to, decide to get out. However, in the mean time one of their kilts was stolen and only one was left.
The king was given two choices by the abductor: either the king gives him the lapis lazuli jewels with extra jewels glazed on top, or he throws the king's infant son into the stream.
The king used both hands to tinker with, or play with, himself in his spare time.
The king thinks jewels of distinction should be burnished (polished).
The king realized he looked like a pig and sought to hone and chisel his body through exercise.
The coral is not found in this tome of jewels since it's really not a mineral, but the remains of small animals.
The king had a coral reef installed in his lake.
The king wished he was as handsome as Fabio standing on the edge (#1167) of a mountain combing his hair, but he realized he was fortunate and auspicious in other ways.
In Silicon Valley, people live like kings in ivy-clad mansions.
Public airlines fly slow and take a long time to arrive so the king has a private jet.
He who possesses the crystal stone is the rightful king of England.
The ball was the only thing that people at the beginning of time had to use as a toy and play with. Poor cavemen.
When the king barks out his orders, all the chandeliers and other exquisite ornaments in the palace start tinkling.
The man being tortured was apprehensive and scared as he saw his tormentor approaching with a hairpin poised to pierce his brain!
First, we sow the rice field, then we plant the flowers, and lastly we plant the corn to complete it.
Ivy grows on the paddy-field ridge encircling the rice field as opposed to the intra-field paddy ridge that divides it in half.
If you think wearing a wool sweater is itchy, just think of how sheep must feel! They must be so sick of wearing that itchy wool all the time!
When your sickness involves inflammation, you will produce phlegm (perhaps inphlegmation?).
He had a curious form of measles: the sickness gave him red marks on his skin that were all in the shape of an umbrella. The doctors of course couldn't explain it...
Hemorrhoids are the sickness suffered by people who sit in meditation for long periods at Buddhist temples 寺."
The SICKNESS called cancer works by self-replication, so that its bad GOODS grow more & more until a vertiable MOUNTAIN of them forms on you-- that's the tumor, the awful sign of cancer.
The sickness that only allows you to eat monkey crotch will surely make you lose weight.
I suffer from silver-sickness, that is, if anything made of silver even touches my skin, even just a trace of it, it leaves a scar.
This sickness seems to prey upon the lowly of society mostly, and causes paralysis in its final stages.
Here you have a picture of him with his apple of the eye: you see him keeping all eyes upon his favourite cow, while leaning on it with his elbow.
If you see mysterious things in front of your eyes you're definitely dizzy.
I paint a huge eye on the side of my pup tent because when I’m at the camping site to make it obvious which tent is mine so I can quickly locate it, and other people comprehend that it's not theirs.

I threw my dart at a pheasant during the hunt, but hit a turkey instead.
That carpenter can never remember where his tools are, so there is a gigantic arrow pointing to his carpenter's square.
From the rocky crag (a rocky hill / mountain) you can see a carrier boat in the distance.
You're determined to get your favorite stone from the bottom of the pond, so you use a grapnel - a small anchor with several hooks, used for anchoring small boats, or to pull up sunken objects.
The king likes white sheets and blue-green stones like the green jade.
This is not an ordinary rock, if you look carefully you will see that it is an ancient inkstone.
This is a rock business card that is was made using a grindstone, so it must be a caveman's.
Teacups and bowls at the Japanese restaurant are usually made of stone and have the name and address of the restaurant written on them.
Those gremlins! At night break they insist on coming out and gluing stones all over the place. These obstacles obstruct my way to work!
Mount Rushmore is a place in the US where the heads of illustrious presidents are carved into the stone of a big cliff.
To qualify as a rocky beach (as opposed to a sandy beach), how many stones does the beach need?
What rock would make the best whetstone? I wandered ten thousand cliffs in search of an answer.
Some mills use an animal, typically an ox or donkey, to rotate the stone. But in this mill the stone is being pulled round by a turkey.
The beautiful woman has to fend off withstand guys every day, who want to drag her to the honorable altar and marry her.
If you want longevity, go to an altar and beseech (ask someone urgently to do something) the gods when you pray.
Picture a Japanese altar that contains ancestral tablets, placed on the right (on the left would be the incense).

Whenever a child is born in Japan, a local Shinto shrine adds the child's name to a list kept at the shrine and declares him or her a "family child" (氏子 ujiko?). After death an ujiko becomes a "family spirit", or "family kami" (氏神 ujigami?). Therefore, if your family name is inscribed in the altar, then you will become a local god.
The ancestral shrine has an altar that shows little reclining figurines of ancestors.

Ancient Japanese officials collected their salarium (salary) in the shrines. A priest would collect their rice grains and salt with a broom, and sweep it unto the altar, where the officials could collect it.
You stand upright at the altar and receive felicitation (congratulations) from everyone in the form of flowers.
I use balancing scales to make sure everyone gets an even amount of Wheaties.
Millet is a small grain whose importance was greater in prehistoric times. Nowadays, it has been supplanted in the West by wheat, and in the East under the bamboo umbrella by rice.
The dude was so upset about going bald that he covered himself with a wheat sack so that only his legs were showing.
Every day, the farmer works in his wheat field, making a wish that his hard labor will bear fruit.
Crabgrass is lowly wild grass, quickly spreading with nasty roots, and difficult to remove out of your wheat field.

A bumper crop is a very full crop. In this particular case, the bumper crop is a wheat crop, grown by this eccentric guy in a grass skirt, who has gone completely native, but knows the secrets of how to get a good crop!

The next hurdle for mission of the rice seedlings with walking legs was the imperial authority. They had to cross through a wheat field, but the imperial authority didn't give permission for rice seedlings and wheat to mix. How to solve this...?
This region only has sparse agriculture. The few farmers hope their scarce wheat crops will do well, but the soil isn't really good.
I'm being obeisant and reverent to the Doctor's orders -- trying to get into shape by eating only wheat and drinking only from that spring.
Ladies, I apologize for peeping through the hole, but, you know, it's just standard protocol.
That hole is still too tight and strait (narrow / cramped). Bring the saw to enlarge it!
You yield and back into a big hole known as a cavern den when you feel like there is danger.
An elephant has to get his tusk drilled when he doesn't keep it clean so he needs to pass through the dentist.

The original Japanese kitchen stoves were powered by electric eels (hey, Edison never made it to the far east!), so a small hole had to be placed in the dirt under the stove (for the eels to swim around in).
In the slave's crotch there is something standing with a vase-like longness. What could it be?
When I hear rustling in the night I stand up and go to check out what it is but it's always just wind.
A characteristic of an outpost station is the lack of usual facilities. Here we see a fortune teller with no crystal ball and having to make do with a vase.
Many repose and pacify peacefully in a blue vase after being cremated.
In polygamous societies a concubine is a woman who lives with a man but is on a lower level than his wives. So the wives can tell her when to stand up or sit down.
The cloaks of Muslims have a tiny clock on their lapel (fold), so that they can keep track of when to pray...
Something is residing in the hem of your cloak. Maybe you should consider cleaning it? キョ コ すそ cuff; hem; foot of mountain.
The lined kimono was lined in such a way that it made people appear to be slimmer than they really were. Even people who didn't fit in the accompanying cloak still bought the lined kimono...
You can 誇 boast (#1244) with words, or you can instead show off your expensive cloak and pleated skirt.
Before you open the sliding door to the core of the nuclear reactor, you'd better put on your anti-radioactivity cloak.

The Chinese panpipe is an old musical instrument made of bamboo. People practiced the Chinese panpipe their whole life just so that they could play for the emperor, often a bad performance would have the emperor take their life away from them.
The bamboo was felled to make a raft.
I see a load of bamboo for sale at a bargain price and decide it’s so cheap that I’ll buy it and make my own bamboo blinds or drapes.
If you are making a rattan box, then the best advice I can give you is to use bamboo and keep it simple.
In Japan they use bamboo poles to dry their clothes on.
Compared to before when Japanese mothers used to throw a hood over their naughty kids and beat them bloody with bamboo, the modern "kitchen-discipline by spatula" seems much more civilized.
If I have any bamboo shoots left over from my stirfry I wrap them up in foil to keep them moist overnight. Then I can use them the next day.

The film director is making a new low budget version of "The Lion the Witch and the Wardrobe". As we watch him, he appears to be constructing something out of bamboo. Finally the director says, "Well, no lion or witch yet, but thanks to this bamboo at least the wardrobe is finished".
Bamboo, in front: Martial arts movie. The hero walks through a bamboo forest, and suddenly an arrow shaft stands quivering in the bamboo tree just in front of him. Time for some action scenes.
I can't play this ancient harp! It's craftsmanship is so mediocre! The bamboo is hard and stiff! Give me a new koto any day of the week.
The only cage that can keep a dragon is made of bamboo.
Mr. T uses a bamboo stick of slender bamboo to beat his taskmaster that he chased up into the tree.

At dinner, my puppet decided to eat her meal the Japanese way using chopsticks. But well, what a problems she had getting those bamboo shoots into her mouth (which should not be that difficult, I would say!).

During post-production of a movie, redaction is required for "red action", or action that results in a bloody accident, like when they miscalculated how large an object Spiderman could hold up with both hands.
My bamboo cane is collapsible. It can fold into two separate bamboo sticks.
A winnowing fan made of bamboo is used to cool off the basketball player.
A smart panda has a backpack and spends most of its time reaching out to grab bamboo to put in.the backpack and eat later.

Each livraison (installment) of the scrapbook is delivered by post, and sits resting on your doorstep for when you get home. Of course, it might blow away so the postman has put heavy bamboo blocks on top of it.
Should you put bamboo through your tongue? If you don't already know the answer yourself, you shouldn't even ask.
To winnow (fan grain to clean it) you need two things: a winnowing fan (箕) and a pelt to use as a bag to collect the grain you winnowed.
Settlings at the bottom of sake are white and made of rice.
New cadets aren't allowed to drink with the seniors if the messed up, so they have to settle for the rice lees at the bottom of the empty sake bottles.
The uncivilized used rice as paste ir batter.
Unhulled rice still needs a blade taken to it.
Rice bran is for old people and young people see it as chaff (worthless garbage): its benefits to sanity in additional to being delicious rice make it an instant sell.
Rice is easy to digest, so if you poke through your excrement or dung, finding bits of rice is uncommon.
Maybe the Japanese ought to rethink their nickname for America. Seriously, the only "rice" I have seen in the wild west is foxtail millet.
To link up with his superhero buddies spiderman likes to drive a car instead of sling around. If they can't find him he fastens his seat belt and starts beeping as if there were an incoming missile.
Spiderman's scrapbook is strong because he made it himself using twine.

When the old lady returned from visiting the fiesta, she found a burglar in her home tied down with carpet yarn. A note said: Regards from you friendly neighborhood Spiderman. Well, she was not amused when she saw the remains of her carpet.
Since only half of his family was left (aunt May, uncle died), Spiderman kept strong ties with her.
Spiderman is put in a jail cell by the fashion police for wearing scarlet. (His fellow inmates include Scarlet O'Hara, Scarlett Johansson, Captain Scarlet, The Scarlet Pimpernel, etc).
To sum up Spiderman's religion, it is a synthesis of spirituality and scientific proof.
A vegetarian from New York replaces all his leather bootlaces with string, saying “There’s no sign of the cow in this thread!”.
Spiderman poses with his hands by his side on his hips and chinstrap to convey being larger than life.

To summarize the newest Spiderman comic: Spidy needs to turn off a computer in a cave (countdown clock for nuclear bomb). However, his human legs get stuck in the soil (some kind of quicksand). The situation seems hopeless... but somehow at the end of the comic, Spiderman has saved the day.
Spidey spends a decameron in a gorgeous place for a break.
Spiderman solemnly swears that he hates embroidery, but everyone knows he loves it, he's always got the sewing machine out when nobody else is around.

Spiderman decides to try a new diet of sprouts to see how it affects the consistency of his web. To his surprise (150m above ground) a lovely line of pongee (Chinese silk fabric) comes out instead. Time to think quickly.
Spiderman's a strange guy, wearing such ornate (elaborately decorated) outfits to make himself better looking.
Spidey helps the rice seedlings using a damask (a reversible figured fabric) magic carpet which was made of a figured cloth in order to travel faster and safer.
Thread with a mysterious origin... catgut (material used for the strings of instruments).
Even though his costume is starting to come apart at the seams as he chases the bad guys, Spiderman is still determined to catch them.
Spiderman seemed taller than he really was, due to the stripes in his uniform. As is to be expected from our textile expert...
No one can accept the fact that Spiderman is a gimp.
A few threads put together is a gossamer (a find silky material consisting of spidey webs), not like yarn which is thicker.
A household spoon is used for the rudder of your model boat.
The gunwale is perhaps the most mysterious part of a boat for it is neither a gun nor a whale. It's just the top part of the boats frame.
My friend's new dangly earrings are interesting--cacti strung together with butterfly cocoons, and they look good when united.
Policymakers' ears have to be attentive to the heart of the public.
When the summons reached his ears, he sprang up and started running motion snared by any problems on the way, which is why he was employed.
The waitress keeps her ears open for anyone talking about drugs so she can indulge in them because she has an addiction problem.
Quiet!!!! The city walls have ears in Jerusalem he exclaimed (exclamation).
Fleas jump onto your crotch, take two drops of blood, and then go on their merry way: what vile insects!
The crab isn’t truly an insect, but certainly looks like one. They’re real tasty, too, but you have to unravel it if you want to eat it.
At the zoo, most animals think of insects as just good sources of protein.
Rather than die, tenacious insects go down into hibernation.
I unbind my tortoise to let him catch that pesky insect the housefly.
The ant is an insect of righteousness, putting the group before its individual concerns.
A bee is an insect with a pointy (see summit (#1562)) stinger.
While I’m game-hunting, I cover my dogs with wax so that they won’t be bothered by insects.
Shrimp are the only “insects” that I can eat in my spare time: anything else requires way too much willpower.
The octopus holds up two of his legs so that they look like antennas and then walks on the other six. He bears a strong resemblance to an insect when he does that.
This is a fresh water mollusk with a shell like a screw, with a spiral shell pattern. When the mollusk has died the shell is used by insects like a house. Thus, insects accumulate in the screw shell.
Cicadas are simple insects: they just pop out of the ground, mate, and die, albeit only every ten years or so.
There he sits, eating insects with his long tongue and blending in with the green ivy. It may no be easy being green, but it is easy being a frog.
The moth is an insect with an ego -- always looking for the (liiime) light.
An insect fits right into the clam's mouth before it clamps shut.

An insect crosses ten thousand cliffs to make it to sea, only to be eaten by an oyster.
Keeping my eye fixed directly over the paper, I hold down the ivy and melt the strands with my magic wand. Viola, ruled lines are created! I bet most people think a machine does it.

In ancient Japan, the most grievous insult was to poke a rival's horse in the eye (consider how rare an expensive a steed was in those days). It was the final step in preparation for a duel to the death.

In Japanese RPGs, you are well advised to add a stole to your clothing as a "freebie" way to add defensive points without swapping out some other garment. But since you can't find them in the shops, you have to "stole" that stole from a glamorous NPC who is ostensibly there to aid your quest.
A monk's sash is a garment that has grains of sand in it from beachside meditations.
At Thanksgiving, it’s uncommon for people to accept humbly the food: whatever they have on the table, most people just dig in.
I’ll do the honors! So, I grabbed the knife and made an incision into the Thanksgiving turkey. Some families just go for it and lop off the head right at the beginning!
At Thanksgiving, I wonder how much food you'll stuff into your mouth!
In order to provide superior counsel, I spoke to him for ten days and inquired about his life.
When receiving a gift, you should say something polite.
In many Sicilian villages, when words are spoken which can never be taken back, a vendetta exists until this retribution - "a turkey for a turkey" - can be extracted.
Words in the East remonstrate (forcefully protest) bad people.
Words meant to lead you astray are those of a riddle.
When a Japanese person says they'll meet you at the capital, it's best to verify whether they mean Tokyo or Kyoto or you'll end up asking them to forgive you in the end.
Compliments are words of approval.
Do you remember that song where they say "Who? let the turkeys out!? Gobble.. gobble.. gobble"?
The prisoner didn't speak a word in response to our query, so we got out our needles and fishhooks to interrogate more.
When you split up from your partner, you say words that cut things off for good, like a guillotine.
You visit a shrine to say your wishes and offer delicious offering to the gods.
The words of the sovereign king inspire the people: never give up! Never surrender! Okay...maybe it wasn't a king.
Words that tell you the results of the whole story really elucidate.
In my house, when I undergo prevarication (say false words) my mother smacks me with a nasty big cooking spoon.
After someone moves into the house next door and you give them a best regards gift, and the words you can now speak are those of familiarity and friendship.
During the check up, I noticed that the doctor had feathers sticking out of different bodyparts so I decided that his diagnosis would be fallible or wrong, since he obviously was a nut.
If you're not thinking and you walk into someone else's home instead of your own then you must use your words to beg pardon.
You should take the words of someone who advises you with a grain of salt.

The lad keeping watch at the cliff came running to town and began pouring out words. Leader: "What? I don't understand a word you're saying. Oh yeah, now I remember... you're the lad who speaks in proverbs.".
If you slander someone with your words, you could end up in jail - Jeffrey Archer.
Your stomach speaks words when your hungry and you always understand the so-called meaning.

You see that guy over there having words with that tree? That's a secret agent. And you see that tree there? That's a secret agent too: the new generation of secret agents is not limited to the human race anymore, making espionage much more interesting.
A study Bible has many footnotes annotated under the words of the Lord.
A parable and an analogy is like putting ketchup on words to make them easier to swallow.
Many cars rumble through the streets as the bousouzoku ride through.
A car with lots of military dog tags passed by the police station. The officer on duty immediately called in for reinforcements to supplement: the notorious veteran soldier killer had just passed by.
Wealthy people tend to have cars with solid gold spokes, sometimes they even spin with the car's not in motion, kinda cool.
When I saw a really cheap car in the paper, my mouth dropped open and I bought it immediately, but the editing was wrong and it forgot to say that I would have to assemble it myself.
You should have seen the shocked countenance / mien (appearance) on the girls' face when she saw the skunk nibbling away at the white human legs of the corpse she found in the woods.
The pink panther is in a dispute with a skunk which is filling a ladle with its stink liquid and then emptying it onto a snoozing pink panther.
Shellfish fishing on a float in a protected area is a despicable way to make a cheap dollar.

The fortune teller writes your fortune on a piece of paper and tells you to affix it to a shell using paste and throw it into the ocean for it to come true. Picture licking the back of the shell like a stamp and affixing it to the fortune.
You get money from the generation above you.
Each shellfish likes to use sea grafts (twigs / shoots) like a straw to drink things.
Bruce Lee made his clams in the bustling city of Hong Kong.
At the border crossing, a man was trying to smuggle a controlled substance in his wooden leg. He would have made it too had he not stumbled and spilled the contents.
After He lost a leg in combat, our sovereign king got a wooden leg as a replacement. Since He thought it was a little boring, he added a hoof for kicks. (Wow, that was totally unintentional, I like).
The soccer player was concerned that his peg leg would affect his ability to kick.
The man who lost his leg in a accident now has to attach a wooden leg to the vestiges / remains of his old leg. He only has himself to blame for drinking and driving.
The amputee boasts about how the ladies just love to straddle his wooden leg.
It's dangerous to kneel with a wooden leg. It might fall off.
The leader's whiskey bottle is filled with soy sauce since he doesn't drink alcohol but likes to pretend he's one of the boys by making a strained face when he takes a swig of a nice thick sauce.
When filling a whiskey bottle with a whey protein mixture, you've got to get the proportions just so or it will just taste like curdled milk.
A whiskey bottle with a cheap label glued to it is surely a hooch (inferior or illicit alcohol).
